metadata.title: Fever in the Retur ning Traveler

abstract.original_text: Fever Child International travel Tropical infections Returning traveler

sentences.segment_text: Fever Child International travel Tropical infections Returning traveler

abstract.original_text: The initial workup of a febrile child without a clear source will be based on the history, physical examination, and potential risk factors but commonly includes laboratory testing. Malaria, enteric fever, and dengue fever are some of the most common and serious tropical infections in pediatric travelers. Clinicians need to remain up-to-date on potential etiologic factors for febrile illnesses to develop a focused plan best suited to the patient's clinical picture.

sentences.segment_text: The initial workup of a febrile child without a clear source will be based on the history ,
physical examination , and potential risk factors but commonly includes laboratory testing .
Malaria , enteric fever , and dengue fever are some of the most common and serious tropical infections in pediatric travelers .
Clinicians need to remain up-to-date on potential etiologic factors for febrile illnesses to develop a focused plan best suited to the patient 's clinical picture .
